title: Just Cause Dev Avalanche Closes Liverpool Studio And Lays Off Workers
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          In August, reports emerged that...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                In August, reports emerged that Microsoft had paused development on Contraband, a co-op smuggler game from Just Cause developer Avalanche. At the time, some sources noted that Microsoft put a "hold" on production rather than a full cancellation. But now, Contraband's fate appears to be sealed as mass layoffs at Avalanche have resulted in the closure of its Liverpool studio.Avalanche announced the news on its official site, and disclosed that it means 31 developers are losing their jobs. Per United Kingdom labor laws, Avalanche initiated "a collective consultation process" in September before moving ahead with the layoffs and closing the studio. However, the rest of the company remains intact."The exceptional talent, passion, and commitment from everyone leaving have impacted every project," reads the message from Avalanche. "We are truly grateful for the dedication and invaluable contributions to Avalanche Studios Group. Our focus remains on supporting the [staff] through this transition and to carry on making great games for our player communities."Contraband was initially announced during an Xbox E3 presentation in 2021. At the time, it was touted as a AAA game set in the 1970s in the fictional country of Bayan. It wasn't the only long-term game that was shuttered by Microsoft this year. Rare's Everwild, the Perfect Dark reboot, and a new MMO from ZeniMax Online Studios were all casualties of a purge of 9,000 people, including Xbox employees.A recent report suggested that Microsoft's struggles to find its footing may be due to sky-high profit goals that have resulted in multiple waves of layoffs at the company.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Black Ops 7's Endgame Will Soon Be Playable For Everyone Right Away
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Treyarch has announced that...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Treyarch has announced that Call of Duty: Black Ops 7's Endgame mode, which players can unlock after completing the campaign, will soon be available to everyone.Beginning Friday, November 21, everyone can jump right into Endgame. Technically you could already do this, as only one player in a group needed to beat the campaign to get into Endgame, but soon everyone can play it.For anyone just catching up, Endgame takes place on the Avalon map where 1-32 players in squads of up to four fight through zones of increasing difficulty. Players enter Avalon in a wingsuit and can then get through the map on foot or in a number of different vehicles as they complete missions.For anyone who has completed the campaign, Treyarch is giving them a variety of bonuses, including double XP tokens and Perkaholic Gobblegums. You can see a rundown of all the bonuses below.We've seen an awesome response to Endgame from players who've already been dropping in, so we're making it available to everyone in #BlackOps7 starting Friday, Nov. 21.Team up with other players to complete objectives, increase your power, earn unique Weapon Camos, and take on‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/2igahTPHv6  ‚Äî Treyarch (@Treyarch) November 19, 2025
  In other Call of Duty news, Treyarch is launching the Nuketown 2025 map on November 20. The game is currently in pre-season, with Season 1 set to begin in early December. For more, check out GameSpot's Black Ops 7 review. You can also catch up on why one US lawmaker is calling for AI regulations after it came to light that Black Ops 7 developers used AI.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: The Shredder Has Knocked Out Over 2 Million Arc Raiders Players, And We Don't Mean The TMNT Villain
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          The first major Arc Raiders...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                The first major Arc Raiders update arrived last week, with the introduction of the Stella Montis map as one of the main highlights. Now, days later, developer Embark Studios has revealed on X some statistics about how players have fared in the abandoned facility. To start, the Shredder enemy is living up to its namesake, knocking out more than 2.2 million players.The Shredder is just one of the new additions with the North Line update for Arc Raiders. The Matriarch is another fresh ARC foe terrorizing players, and it's much larger than the Shredder. However, Embark notes 26,923 Matriachs have been dismantled so far, so players have found success against them. Overall, there have been 25 million visits to Stella Montis. Of those, somehow 117 players discovered a way to down themselves with volcanic rock, which seemingly baffles even Embark.Congrats to every Raider who staked their claim on Stella Montis last week! üèîÔ∏èThe tunnels that awaited at the end of the Breaking New Ground project were cold and unforgiving, here's how the action played out: pic.twitter.com/NzH9orgtI6  ‚Äî ARC Raiders (@ARCRaidersGame) November 19, 2025              Arc Raiders players had to donate resources to initially unlock access to Stella Montis, which they did faster than anticipated. In fact, Embark highlighted that one particular person offered up over 26,000 resources during the community event. Over the past week, Arc Raiders hit a peak of over 480,000 concurrent players on Steam alone--the extraction shooter is also available on the Epic Games Store as well as PS5 and Xbox Series X|S.For more, check out GameSpot's Arc Raiders review. We also have a guides hub full of useful tips, quest info, and skills suggestions.
